properties.name: Message
properties.value: SRP stands for the Single Responsibility Principle

properties.name: Message
properties.value: JavaScript is differnt from Ruby in that it demonstrates asynchronous behaviour. An example of this would be the fetch() function

properties.name: Message
properties.value: Asynchronous behaviour is when a program is executed line by line but it does not wait for functions to complete and return a value

properties.name: Message
properties.value:
HTTP defines a set of request methods to indicate the desired action. They include:
GET,
HEAD,
POST,
PUT,
DELETE,
CONNECT,
OPTIONS,
TRACE,
PATCH

properties.name: Message
properties.value: All information on the web in transferred as a string. The most common format for transferring data is JSON

properties.name: Message
properties.value: In Javascript, a variable without a value has the data type 'undefined'. The other data types are: Number, String, Boolean and Object.
